column4: can someone tell me what the proper command in ubuntu to mount a nfs file system is ?????????
ntfs?
no nfs, network file system.
what server version (ex. 9.04) are you using?
sudo mount example.hostname.com:/ubuntu /local/ubuntu
thanks.
your welcome.
had been doing it wrong for 20 mins lol
I'm suprised they didn't have it on there I had problems with that before, took me a few days
of course you can only go as fast as your hardware, besides using overclocking for processors
http://nfs.sourceforge.net/nfs-howto/
i got nfs setup, just a subdir of the dir i got shared, i cant enter it, since root is the owner on the other box, but i did chown pete
but i dont think it worked
did you set the .conf files to the right permissions?
not every dir is this way, jut one....
samba works perfectly.
one sec.
/home/pete 192.168.1.3(rw,sync,no_subtree_check)
look at this, drwxrwxrwx 14 pete root
chown changes only the first one to pete, not the second
that dir /home/pete/storage is a mounted partition btw
